title: How to Make a Bathroom in Minecraft

steps.title: Create a base for your toilet.
steps.content: Create a base for your toilet. Make sure that it’s 3 blocks wide and 2 blocks long.

steps.title: Make a hole in the base.
steps.content: Make a hole in the base. In the second block of the row that’s closest to you, eliminate the block to make a hole.

steps.title: Place another block in front of the hole.
steps.content: Place another block in front of the hole. This will contain the water.

steps.title: Add water.
steps.content: Add water. Put water on the hole.

steps.title: Create a toilet water tank.
steps.content: Create a toilet water tank. In the second block of the row that’s farthest from you, place a block that will act as the toilet water tank.

steps.title: Place a (wooden or iron) trap door on top of the hole with water in it.
steps.content: Place a (wooden or iron) trap door on top of the hole with water in it. This will act as a toilet seat.

steps.title: Make a hole on the ceiling.
steps.content: Make a hole on the ceiling. It would be best to create a hole in a corner.

steps.title: Build a chimney-like structure.
steps.content: Build a chimney-like structure. Build it on the roof where the hole is.

steps.title: Put water in it.
steps.content: Put water in it. The water should come down through the hole as a pillar of water for you to shower in. To turn the shower off, place a block in the hole. If you are good (basic learners should be able to do this too) with redstone, feel free to use a dispenser and a lever.

steps.title: Make a 3 x 5 platform.
steps.content: Make a 3 x 5 platform. Make sure it's 2 blocks high against a wall in your bathroom.

steps.title: Create a long hole.
steps.content: Create a long hole. On the side closest to the wall, break 6 blocks.

steps.title: Place stairs on the sides of your bath.
steps.content: Place stairs on the sides of your bath. This will allow you to easily climb into it.
